intro: Stephania forsteri, commonly known as the Forster's stephania, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody vines and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elliptical berries. Its roots contain alkaloids and have been used in traditional medicine. Stephania forsteri thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
